favourite.article: Oh Lord Jesus. At the closing of this age, Just before Your kingdom’s dawn, May You gain a people, Lord,
Hallelujah! We must enjoy with saints of an echoing ceaseless praise.

Yes, LORD may You gain a group of people who are willing to pour out their everything to You, like Mary who pour her best fo YOU...Praise You for Your Mercy, Raise us up to be the Group of People that will satisfy You at the end of this age...
At the closing of this age, Just before Your kingdom's dawn, May You gain a people, Lord, For Your dwelling place, Your home. Since for me You gave Your all, Everything I lay aside; For Your church my all I'd give, That You would be satisfied.

The second verse really shows me that I shouldn't worry about what's going on in my life. I just realize that God is all that matters, and I just feel so moved... It's that feeling where you're so joyful, that it can't be explained.

"Every spiritual experience is a dream. I cannot tell you how many dreams I have had through the years. Coming into the church life is a dream. Knowing the practicality of the church is also a dream. Many times we have said, "My, this experience is so good that it must be a dream. What a dream has come to me!" The more dreams we have, the better, for the more dreams we have, the more we touch and enjoy the ladder."
(Life-Study of Genesis, Msg. 68 (c) LSM)

I really treasure this hymn in my heart, it's so sweet to have this realization that there's no place on this earth like the church, our real family where in there's no tears, no sorrows, but ceaseless praise and real enjoyment of the Lord. May the Lord preserve our heart waiting for Him with this realization "to give our all for the church and lay aside all the things that is not of Him. Saints, may we satisfy the Lord's desire.
Praise the Lord. I enjoy this hymn. It refreshes my first love to the Lord.
I love the lyrics and the new tune.
I like this song because it made me realize how blessed I am that I am in the church, which is God's family; touching me to give my all for the church and to Him.

This song speaks of a family life and rest. I am thankful to be in the church--Gods rest and mine. If we can see this we are blessed. Thank You Lord You give us so many riches by the Spirit! Thank You Lord for hymns of thanksgiving and encouragment and life. May all my brothers and sisters in Christ be blessed by the words in this sweet hymn. Amen

This is the true church life, a foretaste of the New Jerusalem! Through our appreciation, enjoyment and experience of Christ, His bride is being prepared, even to be consummated in the New Jerusalem! What a glory! Praise the Lord!
What a grace and mercy to be in God's own family! Praise the Lord He has brought us to where boundless blessings flow.
I really treasure the content of this hymn. may all of its content be a reality to all of the saints. amen
I really like this song. May the Lord be magnified. He's really real sweet and subjective.

Well, this is probably a good song because this song can bring me to blend and sing with the saints. Praise the Lord whenever I sang this song I felt that there's a joy within me, and thus it stirs up my spirit.
